meanings.definition: The ideas, attitudes, or activities that are regarded as normal or conventional; the dominant trend.
meanings.sent1: In the mainstream, most people enjoy watching popular movies.
meanings.sent2: Listening to pop music is considered mainstream.
meanings.sent3: It's funny how my grandma thinks social media is not part of the mainstream.
meanings.sent4: Her fashion sense is so unique, she stands out from the mainstream crowd.
meanings.sent5: The mainstream opinion on the matter is clear and widely accepted.

meanings.definition: To place (a student) in the regular school program.
meanings.sent1: The school decided to mainstream the new student into the regular classes.
meanings.sent2: Teachers work hard to mainstream students with special needs.
meanings.sent3: The principal joked that he wanted to mainstream the class clown into the math club.
meanings.sent4: She hoped to mainstream her friend into the study group for better grades.
meanings.sent5: The school counselor helped mainstream the transfer student seamlessly into the school community.
